newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian share exchange opens, competes with OTC.
newsitem.headline: Russian share exchange opens, competes with OTC.

text.p: The Russian Exchange (RTSB), a potential competitor to the over-the-counter Russian Trading System (RTS), began spot trading of shares on Tuesday, an official at the exchange said.

At 1255 GMT, 10 100-share lots of leading Russian oil company LUKoil LKOH.RTS 0#LKOH.RUO had been traded for $15.47 per share, said Alexander Orlov, chief expert at the exchange's research department.
"It is very good for the first day. Operators always watch a new market at first," he said.
He said that the exchange had bids for utility Mosenergo MSNG.RTS 0#MSNG.RUO but that no trades had happened yet.
At 1248 GMT, LUKoil was trading at $15.40 on the RTS, which has about $40 million total reported daily turnover.
